snippet: For nine years Inocente Izucar was homeless in San Diego, moving more than 30 times, but that didn’t stop this teenager from having her first art show, a process documented in the film “Inocente.”
abstract: Teenage artist Inocente Izucar, who spent nine years of her life homeless, is the subject of Sean Fine and Andrea Nix Fine's documentary film Inocente, which has won awards on the festival circuit and is about to have its television premiere on MTV.
lead_paragraph: For nine years Inocente Izucar was homeless in San Diego, moving more than 30 times, but that didn’t stop this teenager from having her first art show, a process documented in the film “Inocente.”

headline.main: Dreaming of a Life as Vivid as Her Art
headline.print_headline: Dreaming Of a Life As Vivid As Her Art
